question_stem: A particle moves along a straight line. Its displacement, \(s\) metres, from a fixed point O at time \(t\) seconds is given by \(s = t^2 - 8t + 3\).

parts.question_text: Find the set of values of \(t\) for which the particle is more than 5 metres from the fixed point O.
parts.solution_text:
The particle is more than 5 metres from O when \(|s| > 5\).
This gives two inequalities:
1. \(s > 5\): \(t^2 - 8t + 3 > 5 \implies t^2 - 8t - 2 > 0\)
We use the quadratic formula to find the roots of \(t^2 - 8t - 2 = 0\):
\(t = \frac{-(-8) \pm \sqrt{(-8)^2 - 4(1)(-2)}}{2(1)} = \frac{8 \pm \sqrt{64 + 8}}{2} = \frac{8 \pm \sqrt{72}}{2} = \frac{8 \pm 6\sqrt{2}}{2} = 4 \pm 3\sqrt{2}\)
So, \(t < 4 - 3\sqrt{2}\) or \(t > 4 + 3\sqrt{2}\).
2. \(s < -5\): \(t^2 - 8t + 3 < -5 \implies t^2 - 8t + 8 < 0\)
We use the quadratic formula to find the roots of \(t^2 - 8t + 8 = 0\):
\(t = \frac{-(-8) \pm \sqrt{(-8)^2 - 4(1)(8)}}{2(1)} = \frac{8 \pm \sqrt{64 - 32}}{2} = \frac{8 \pm \sqrt{32}}{2} = \frac{8 \pm 4\sqrt{2}}{2} = 4 \pm 2\sqrt{2}\)
So, \(4 - 2\sqrt{2} < t < 4 + 2\sqrt{2}\).
Combining these inequalities, the particle is more than 5 metres from O when \(t < 4 - 3\sqrt{2}\) or \(t > 4 + 3\sqrt{2}\) or \(4 - 2\sqrt{2} < t < 4 + 2\sqrt{2}\).
